document.docAuthor: Duan, Yani, Zhang, Yating & Dietrich, Christopher H.
document.masterDocTitle: Six new species of Stenometopiini (Hemiptera: Cicadellidae: Deltocephalinae) with redescription of additional species and new distributional records

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Six new species of Stenometopiini (Hemiptera: Cicadellidae: Deltocephalinae) with redescription of additional species and new distributional records

heading.emphasis:
Stirellus catalinus ( Beamer & Tuthill, 1934 )
n. rec.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Penestirellus
to
Stirellus
;
Emeljanov, 1962 : 393
[comb. not given]. Description. Length. Male: 2.9–3.2mm ; female: 3.2–3.9mm .

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 3.
Stirellus catalinus
A–G: habitus, dorsal view; H, I: habitus, lateral view; J: face; K: the end of female abdomen, ventral view. A–D: male; E–K: female.

FIGURE 4.
Stirellus catalinus
A, B: male pygofer lobe, lateral view; C: male pygofer and segments X and XI, dorsal view; D: valve, subgenital plates and styles, ventral view; E, F: subgenital plate, ventral view; G: style, dorsal view; H: connective, dorsal view; I: aedeagus, dorsal view; J–K: aedeagus, lateral view; L: connective and aedeagus, lateral view.

FIGURE 5.
Stirellus catalinus
A–D: habitus, dorsal view; E: habitus, lateral view; F: face; G: the end of female abdomen, ventral view. A: male; B–G: female.

subSubSection.paragraph: Morphology. Head subequal in width to pronotum, subconical, anterior margin rounded to face, acutely angled in dorsal and lateral view ( Figs 3 A–I; 5A–E). Crown longer than width between eyes ( Figs 3 A–G; 5A–D). Anteclypeus tapering to apex, extending beyond normal curve of genae ( Figs 3J ; 5F ). Pronotum median length shorter than median length of crown. Mesonotum and scutellum nearly as long as pronotum ( Figs 3 A–G; 5A–D). Forewing macropterous to submacropterous, usually exposing apex of abdomen in female and sometimes in male, appendix weakly developed, R branches not reflexed ( Figs 3 A–I; 5A–E).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 6.
Stirellus catalinus
A, C: male pygofer and segments X and XI, lateral and dorsal view, respectively; B: male pygofer lobe, lateral view; D: valve, subgenital plates and styles, ventral view; E: style, dorsal view; F: connective, dorsal view; G: aedeagus, dorsal view; H: aedeagus, lateral view; I: connective and aedeagus, lateral view.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks. This species is here recorded from Mexico for the first time. There are two more or less distinct color forms (cf. Figs 3 and 5 ), both of which were collected simultaneously in the same habitats at most Mexican localities listed above. Therefore, these apparently do not represent seasonal forms, as seen in the temperate North American species
S. bicolor
.
